intro: Sida calliantha, commonly known as Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in a variety of habitats, including disturbed soils and along roadsides. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sida calliantha is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
